taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family asteraceae;tribe eupatorieae;genus eupatorium;species rotundifolium;variety rotundifolium

bio:treatment.description: Leaf blades 3-nerved from bases, 20–43 × 13–35 mm, broadest near bases, bases broadly subtruncate to broadly cuneate, margins crenate. 2n = 20, 30.
Moist, low ground, roadsides, margins of ponds, sandy soils;
Ala., Ark., Del., Fla., Ga., Ind., Ky., La., Md., Mass., Miss., N.J., N.C., Ohio, Okla., Pa., R.I., S.C., Tenn., Tex., Va., W.Va.
bio:treatment.discussion: Variety rotundifolium includes both sexual diploids and apomictic polyploids, which are morphologically not distinguishable. The sexual diploids are somewhat more restricted geographically, occurring in a band across northern Florida and southern Georgia.
